title: PMK Towing Service — Single-page marketing site

requirements.summary: Build a responsive single-page marketing site with clear PMK TOWING SERVICE branding and English-only copy.
acceptanceCriteria: The site loads as a complete, coherent website with clear branding for “PMK TOWING SERVICE”.
All visible text is in English.
Layout is responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page layout shell (header + main + footer) and render the full marketing page content in English with responsive structure. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card/Separator) to compose UI without modifying any files under frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a reusable layout component for consistent spacing, section containers, and responsive header/footer structure used by App. Use shadcn-ui components where helpful (composition only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add prominent click-to-call contact actions using +917842969695 with a mobile-visible persistent CTA.
acceptanceCriteria: The phone number is displayed exactly as “+917842969695”.
At least one button/link uses a tel:+917842969695 href and works in the browser.
A call-to-action is visible without scrolling on a typical mobile viewport (e.g., in the hero section or a sticky footer).

file_operations.description: Create a persistent mobile CTA (e.g., sticky bottom bar) with a primary click-to-call button linking to tel:+917842969695 and showing the number exactly as “+917842969695”. Use shadcn-ui Button for consistent styling (composition only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a Contact section containing the phone number displayed exactly as “+917842969695” plus at least one tel:+917842969695 link/button and supporting contact text in English. Use shadcn-ui components (Button/Card) as needed (composition only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the CallToActionBar into the page so it is visible on mobile without scrolling (and ensure at least one click-to-call action appears in the hero area as well). Use composition with shadcn-ui where applicable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement clearly labeled Hero, Services, Service Area (Nellore), and Contact sections with fast navigation/structure.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation or clear page structure allows users to find Services, Service Area (Nellore), and Contact information quickly.
Services section lists towing/recovery offerings in plain English (no placeholder lorem ipsum).

file_operations.description: Create the Hero section with clear PMK TOWING SERVICE branding, a short English value proposition for towing/recovery in Nellore, and prominent in-hero call-to-call action. Use shadcn-ui Button for the hero CTA (composition only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a Services section listing plain-English towing/recovery offerings (e.g., emergency towing, breakdown recovery, flatbed towing, accident recovery, outstation assistance as applicable) with clear labels. Use shadcn-ui Card/Separator for consistent presentation (composition only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a Service Area section explicitly mentioning Nellore and describing coverage in clear English (no external maps). Use shadcn-ui components for section styling if helpful (composition only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a header navigation that links to on-page section anchors (Hero, Services, Service Area (Nellore), Contact) for quick access. Use shadcn-ui components for buttons/menus if used (composition only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire Hero, Services, Service Area (Nellore), and Contact sections into a single-page flow with stable anchor IDs and include HeaderNav for quick navigation. Use composition with shadcn-ui where applicable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent emergency roadside/towing theme (non blue/purple-dominant) across typography, colors, spacing, and components.
acceptanceCriteria: The site uses a consistent theme (colors, typography, buttons, section styling) across all sections.
Primary theme is not dominated by blue/purple.

file_operations.description: Define a cohesive theme using CSS variables/Tailwind base layers with a towing/emergency palette (e.g., amber/orange + dark neutrals), consistent typography, and section spacing. Ensure the primary styling is not blue/purple-dominant. Keep styling consistent with shadcn-ui variable-driven theming (compose; do not modify frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Apply consistent layout spacing, section backgrounds, and typography classes so all sections share the same theme and visual rhythm across mobile/desktop. Use composition with shadcn-ui components where applicable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add generated static logo and hero images under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
The logo appears in the header/hero area and the hero image/illustration appears in the hero section.
Images are loaded as static assets (not served from the backend).

file_operations.description: Add the generated static logo asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/pmk-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated static hero visual asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/pmk-hero.dim_1600x900.png.
Render the logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/pmk-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header area with accessible alt text and responsive sizing.
Render the hero image from frontend/public/assets/generated/pmk-hero.dim_1600x900.png within the hero section (responsive, with appropriate alt text) and ensure it complements the CTA content.
